import CodeBlock from '../../components/ui/CodeBlock.astro';

The `SyncedDbConfig` object allows you to customize the behavior of the Spooky client.

<CodeBlock
  code={`interface SyncedDbConfig<Schema> {
  // The runtime schema generated by the CLI
  schema: Schema;
  
  // The raw SURQL schema string (also generated)
  schemaSurql: string;

// Logging verbosity
logLevel?: 'debug' | 'info' | 'warn' | 'error';

database: {
// Unique identifier for your app to sandbox data in IndexedDB
namespace: string;

    // Database name
    database: string;

    // WebSocket URL for the Spooky Sidecar
    endpoint: string;

    // Storage engine (currently only 'indexeddb' is supported effectively)
    store?: 'indexeddb' | 'memory';

};
}`}
lang="typescript"
/>

## Options Detail

### `database.endpoint`

This should point to your **SurrealDB** URL (e.g., `ws://localhost:8000`). the Spooky Client connects directly to the database.

### `logLevel`

- `debug`: Verbose logging of every mutation and sync event.
- `info`: General lifecycle events (connected, synced).
- `warn`: Recoverable errors (network disconnects).
- `error`: Critical failures.
